transportAdvice: The city is served by a local bus network that connects the main tourist areas including the national park entrance, making public transit a viable option for budget travelers. Taxis and informal transfer vehicles are widely available, though walking between major attractions is not practical given the distances involved.

weather.description: Hot and humid with frequent afternoon thunderstorms, making waterproof gear essential for falls visits.
Continued heat and heavy rainfall keeps the falls at impressive volume but trails can be slippery.
Still very wet and warm, with the falls often at their most powerful due to accumulated rainfall.
Temperatures begin to ease and rain becomes less frequent, offering more comfortable sightseeing conditions.
Mild and pleasant with occasional showers; a good shoulder-season month for visiting.
Cooler and drier, with clear skies common and comfortable conditions for walking the park trails.
The driest and coolest month, popular with visitors; water levels may be lower but crowds are higher.
Still dry and mild with low humidity, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Temperatures begin rising again and occasional rain returns, with the landscape becoming greener.
Warm and increasingly humid with moderate rainfall; a transitional month before the wet season peaks.
Heat and humidity build noticeably with more frequent storms, though the falls gain volume and drama.
Hot, humid, and rainy as the wet season peaks; expect lush scenery and powerful falls but prepare for downpours.
